page.title: 01MOORS NORTH OF BELMONT
page.content: All the land in this block falls within the West Pennine Moors Recreational Area. It is owned by the North West Water Authority, and most is leased to two tenant farmers, with the A675 Bolton to Preston road dividing the two farms. This is a water catchment area feeding Belmont Reservoir, which flows out into Eagley Brook whose water is used to dilute effluent further downstream. It is largely enclosed rough grazing land, mainly used for sheep and cattle. Geologically it is sandstone laid down in the Carboniferous era, with a thick carpet of peat. It is popular with walkers and ramblers as there are several public footpaths across the moors. Varied bird life and small mammals are all found here. Only three inhabited dwellings survive from about eight some 50 years ago.
